link.script: window.setTimeout(function () { document.title = "Home - Amite County School District"; }, 500);

p.span: Attention: Schools will be closed for the remainder of the year.

span.em: To provide a quality formal education for the youth in our community.

div.span: On April 14, 2020, the MS Governor gave the official order to close schools for the remainder of the school year. So,students and teachers will not return to the school buildings, until next school year. Although we are saddened by this news, we know it is necessary for the safety and well-being of our students, teachers, and community members.

We will continue to take guidance from the governor and state department of education, while keeping everyone updated on any changes that we need to make. Please check for updates on our district web page and facebook account routinely. End of the year information concerning final grades, report cards, promotions, course credits, transcripts and graduation will be continuously updated.
Remember we are all going through this for the first time but together we will prevail and be stronger. We thank you all for your support and patience as we go.

p.span: UPDATES: Due to the Covid 19 Virus Outbreak
Graduation - We are sorry to announce that the May 2020 Commencement Ceremony will be cancelled. It will be rescheduled at a later date (to be determined).

I know the disappointment you and your families are feeling. Your final months as a Trojan should be memorable times with family and friends celebrating accomplishments, reflecting on the past and anticipating the future. Now, without warning, it feels like a sudden stop in all that you've been working toward since kindergarten. Please know that graduation and other celebratory events are a priority to us and we are considering ways to best celebrate you.

Educational Opportunities - Due to the Stay in Place Order and safety for all, we will no longer hand out educational packets. You may refer to the district website for several online grade level resources for students to continue advancing their educational progress. We will continue to add learning websites as they come available. We are monitoring state updates daily and will adjust if necessary.

img.alt: Reports Cards Will be Given Out the Week of May 18th
img.title: Reports Cards Will be Given Out the Week of May 18th
